title: DarkPattern Shield: public safety awareness app for subscription fraud & social media manipulation

requirements.text: Create the DarkPattern Shield homepage with a clear, public-safety-oriented explanation of modern dark patterns (e.g., “₹1 trial → ₹599 auto-renew” scams seen in social media ads), and include three prominent CTA buttons: “Check Offer Risk”, “Report Scam”, and “Know Your Risk”.

quotes: Build a clean, hackathon-ready public safety awareness web application called “DarkPattern Shield”… Homepage… Clear CTA buttons: “Check Offer Risk”, “Report Scam”, “Know Your Risk”.

acceptanceCriteria: Homepage loads as the default route and displays the product name “DarkPattern Shield”.
Homepage includes at least 2 real-life-style examples of hidden subscription/auto-renew patterns in plain English.
Homepage includes three clearly visible CTA buttons labeled exactly: “Check Offer Risk”, “Report Scam”, “Know Your Risk”.
Each CTA navigates to the corresponding page/section in the app.

requirements.text: Implement a consistent modern, minimal “smart city cyber safety” visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) that looks hackathon-ready and product-like, avoiding a blue/purple-dominant palette.

quotes: Modern, minimal UI suitable for a smart city public safety platform.
The final output should look like a real smart-city cyber safety product, even though it is a prototype.

acceptanceCriteria: All pages share a consistent layout system (header/nav, content container, footer or equivalent).
Theme is applied consistently to buttons, form inputs, cards, alerts, and headings.
Primary palette is not predominantly blue/purple.

requirements.text: Build the “Subscription Trap Detector” page: provide a single text input where users can paste an ad link or offer text; scan the input using basic keyword matching (e.g., trial, auto-renew, subscription, ₹, /month); and display a Risk Level (Low/Medium/High) with a clear warning message plus a short educational note explaining dark patterns in simple language.

quotes: Subscription Trap Detector… Input field where users paste an ad link or offer text. System scans for keywords like: trial, auto-renew, subscription, ₹/month. Displays a Risk Level (Low / Medium / High) with a clear warning message. Educational note explaining dark patterns in simple language.

acceptanceCriteria: User can paste text or a URL into the detector input and submit/trigger analysis.
The UI displays one of: Low, Medium, High based on keyword matches (basic logic; no AI).
The UI includes a warning/explanation message that changes appropriately with the risk level.
An educational note defining dark patterns is always visible on the page in plain English.

requirements.text: Build the “Personal Digital Risk Test” page as a 5-question quiz focused on subscription/cancellation awareness and social media ad behaviors; compute a “Digital Vulnerability Score”; show the score with an interpretable label; and present exactly 3 personalized safety tips derived from the user’s answers/score.

quotes: Personal Digital Risk Test… Short quiz (5 questions)… Calculate and show a Digital Vulnerability Score. Provide 3 personalized safety tips.

acceptanceCriteria: Quiz contains exactly 5 questions covering: reading cancellation policies, clicking social media ads, checking auto-debits (can include 2 additional aligned questions).
After submission, the user sees a Digital Vulnerability Score and a short explanation of what it means.
Results include exactly 3 personalized safety tips that vary based on answers and/or score tier.
User can retake the quiz without refreshing the page.

requirements.text: Implement the “Scam Reporting” module UI: a simple form allowing users to submit scam text and/or a screenshot description (text-only), choose a scam category (Subscription Trap, Fake Discount, OTP Scam), and submit the report.

quotes: Scam Reporting Module… Simple form to upload scam text or screenshot description. Categorize scam types (Subscription Trap, Fake Discount, OTP Scam).

acceptanceCriteria: Form includes fields for scam text (required) and screenshot description (optional), plus a required category selector with exactly the three specified categories.
On submit, the UI shows success/failure feedback.
After successful submit, the form resets or offers a clear “Submit another report” action.

requirements.text: Add backend support (single Motoko actor) to persist scam reports and compute summary stats, including: total number of reports and the most common scam type. Expose query/update methods needed by the frontend to submit reports and fetch dashboard stats.

quotes: Save reports in a database… Show a small dashboard with total reports and most common scam type.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend provides an update method to create a report with: text, optional screenshot description, category, and created timestamp (timestamp may be stored as an integer).
Backend stores reports across canister calls (stable storage as appropriate for the template).
Backend provides a query method returning total report count and the most common category (ties handled deterministically).
Frontend can successfully submit a report and subsequently see dashboard stats reflect the new report.

requirements.text: Create a small “Reports Dashboard” view (can be embedded in the Scam Reporting page or as a separate page) that displays total reports and the most common scam type, updating after new submissions.

quotes: Show a small dashboard with total reports and most common scam type.

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard shows total reports and most common scam type using data fetched from the backend.
Dashboard refreshes after a successful report submission (automatic or via a clear refresh action).

requirements.text: Create the “Browser Extension Concept” page with a visual mockup of a browser warning popup (implemented in UI) and a clear explanation of how an extension would warn users before payment; do not implement any real extension functionality.

quotes: Browser Extension Concept Page… Visual mockup of a browser warning popup… No real extension functionality required—demo concept only.

acceptanceCriteria: Page contains a visually distinct popup mock (e.g., card styled like a browser dialog) showing a warning title, risk indicator, and suggested action text.
Page includes a short explanation of the concept flow (e.g., detect risk signals, show warning before payment) in plain English.
No browser-extension APIs or actual extension packaging is included.

requirements.text: Add app navigation so users can reach: Home, Subscription Trap Detector, Personal Digital Risk Test, Scam Reporting (with dashboard), and Browser Extension Concept; ensure CTAs on the homepage route correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: A persistent navigation element (header/sidebar) links to all major pages.
Homepage CTA buttons navigate to the correct pages.
Routes render without blank screens or console errors.

requirements.text: Generate and include a small set of static brand/illustration assets and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated to enhance the product-like “smart city cyber safety” feel.

quotes: The final output should look like a real smart-city cyber safety product, even though it is a prototype.

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are committed under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend (no backend image routing).
At least a logo and one background/illustration are visibly used in the UI.

constraints: Backend must be implemented in Motoko using a single-actor architecture (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Frontend must be implemented in React + TypeScript with Tailwind + shadcn-style composition; do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths specified by the platform.
Use basic keyword logic for risk detection (no heavy AI/LLM integrations).
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: Do not implement Python Flask, SQLite, HTML templates, or Bootstrap (not supported in this project environment).
Do not implement a real browser extension or any browser-extension APIs; concept/demo UI only.
Do not add third-party authentication providers; only Internet Identity is supported if authentication is later needed.
Do not add real-time features (WebSockets/chat/push notifications).

required: Minimal shield logo mark with subtle circuit lines, monochrome (darkpattern-shield-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Futuristic smart-city skyline silhouette background, dark neutral palette (smart-city-background.dim_1920x1080.png)
Browser warning popup mock illustration on a neutral backdrop (extension-popup-mock.dim_1200x800.png)
